discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment: @Boutry @thery do you think there is a chance you have the time to do a review before the release?

discussion.author: Boutry
discussion.comment:
> @Boutry @thery do you think there is a chance you have the time to do a review before the release?

I will try and do it by Monday. Do you have examples of reviews? I checked some of the closed PR and there were few comments. So I am still a bit unclear about how a review should look like. (I looked at the checklist though.)

discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment:
I guess you could take example from similar PRs (some went through as they were, others required more work):
- https://github.com/math-comp/math-comp/pull/618
- https://github.com/math-comp/math-comp/pull/585
- https://github.com/math-comp/math-comp/pull/574
- https://github.com/math-comp/math-comp/pull/558

discussion.author: Boutry
discussion.comment:
> I guess you could take example from similar PRs (some went through as they were, others required more work):
> 
> * #618
> * #585
> * #574
> * #558

Thank you for the links. I believe line 284 in the Changelog belongs to another PR. Aside from that everything looks good to me.

discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment:
@Boutry I attended the issue, thanks for pointing it out.

Please click on "Files changed" , then "Review changes", then type a review and click on "Approve", or if you changed your mind "Comment" or "Request Changes". Then ask a core developer to merge if you accepted, by tagging `@math-comp/core`.

discussion.author: Boutry
discussion.comment: Doesn't Laurent need to approve it as well?

discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment:
> Doesn't Laurent need to approve it as well?

Ask @ybertot

discussion.author: Boutry
discussion.comment: He just called me and seems fine with just my approval. Thank you for the help!

discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment: @math-comp/core when CI passes, I guess you can merge. Grazie mille

discussion.author: gares
discussion.comment: I don't get exactly how this merge process works, but I guess che posso premere il bottone
